@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2011-2012 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Martin Wittemann (wittemann) Daniel Wagner (danielwagner) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: DOM traversal module

@description.name: @description
@description.body: String attributes used to determine if two DOM nodes are equal as defined in DOM Level 3

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal helper for getAncestors and getAncestorsUntil

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {String} Selector that indicates where to stop including
 ancestor elements
@param.description:
Selector that indicates where to stop including
 ancestor elements

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Collection containing the ancestor elements
@return.description: Collection containing the ancestor elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper which returns the element from the given argument. If it's a collection, it returns it's first child. If it's a string, it tries to use the string as selector and returns the first child of the new collection.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Node|var} If a node can be extracted, the node element will be return.
   If not, at given argument will be returned.
@return.description:
If a node can be extracted, the node element will be return.
   If not, at given argument will be returned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper that attempts to convert the given argument into a DOM node

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Node|null} DOM node or null if the conversion failed
@return.description: DOM node or null if the conversion failed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a map containing the given DOM node's attribute names and values

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} Map of attribute names/values
@return.description: Map of attribute names/values

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper function that iterates over a set of items and applies the given qx.dom.Hierarchy method to each entry, storing the results in a new Array. Duplicates are removed and the items are filtered if a selector is provided.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: collection {Array} Collection to iterate over (any Array-like object)
@param.description: Collection to iterate over (any Array-like object)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: method {String} Name of the qx.dom.Hierarchy method to apply
@param.description: Name of the qx.dom.Hierarchy method to apply

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {String?} Optional selector that elements to be included
 must match
@param.description:
Optional selector that elements to be included
 must match

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} Result array
@return.description: Result array

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the given object is a DOM element

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the object is a DOM element
@return.description: true if the object is a DOM element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the given object is a DOM node

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the object is a DOM node
@return.description: true if the object is a DOM node

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the node has the given node name

@param.name: @param
@param.body: nodeName {String} the node name to check for
@param.description: the node name to check for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the node has the given name
@return.description: true if the node has the given name

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the given object is a DOM document object

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
node {Object|qxWeb} Object to check. If the value is a qxWeb
 collection, isDocument will check the first item.
@param.description:
Object to check. If the value is a qxWeb
 collection, isDocument will check the first item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the object is a DOM document
@return.description: true if the object is a DOM document

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the given object is a DOM document fragment object

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
node {Object|qxWeb} Object to check. If the value is a qxWeb
 collection, isDocumentFragment will check the first item.
@param.description:
Object to check. If the value is a qxWeb
 collection, isDocumentFragment will check the first item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the object is a DOM document fragment
@return.description: true if the object is a DOM document fragment

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the DOM2 defaultView (window) for the given node.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Window} the defaultView for the given node
@return.description: the defaultView for the given node

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks whether the given object is a DOM text node

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {Object} the object to be tested

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the object is a textNode
@return.description: true if the object is a textNode

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether the given object is a browser window object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
obj {Object|qxWeb} the object to be tested. If the value
 is a qxWeb collection, isDocument will check the first item.
@param.description:
the object to be tested. If the value
 is a qxWeb collection, isDocument will check the first item.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the object is a window object
@return.description: true if the object is a window object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the owner document of the given node

@param.name: @param
@param.body: selector {Node|String|qxWeb} Node to get the document for
@param.description: Node to get the document for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Document|null} The document of the given DOM node
@return.description: The document of the given DOM node

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the DOM node's name as a lowercase string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} node name
@return.description: node name

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the text content of a node where the node type may be one of NODEELEMENT, NODEATTRIBUTE, NODETEXT, NODECDATA

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {Node|String|qxWeb} the node from where the search should start. If the
 node has subnodes the text contents are recursively retrieved and joined
@param.description:
the node from where the search should start. If the
 node has subnodes the text contents are recursively retrieved and joined

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} the joined text content of the given node or null if not
 appropriate.
@return.description:
the joined text content of the given node or null if not
 appropriate.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the given node is a block node

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the node is a block node
@return.description: true if the node is a block node

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Determines if two DOM nodes are equal as defined in the DOM Level 3 isEqualNode spec. Also works in legacy browsers without native isEqualNode support.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the nodes are equal
@return.description: true if the nodes are equal

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an element to the collection

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
el {Element|qxWeb} DOM element to add to the collection.
 If a collection is given, only the first element will be added
@param.description:
DOM element to add to the collection.
 If a collection is given, only the first element will be added

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} The collection for chaining
@return.description: The collection for chaining

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a set of elements containing all of the unique immediate children of each of the matched set of elements. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Collection containing the child elements
@return.description: Collection containing the child elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Executes the provided callback function once for each item in the collection.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
fn {Function} Callback function which is called with two parameters
  • current item - DOM node
  • current index - Number
@param.description:
Callback function which is called with two parameters
  • current item - DOM node
  • current index - Number

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} The collection for chaining
@return.description: The collection for chaining

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a set of elements containing the parent of each element in the collection. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Collection containing the parent elements
@return.description: Collection containing the parent elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if any element of the current collection is child of any element of a given parent collection.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: parent {qxWeb | String} Collection or selector of the parent collection to check.
@param.description: Collection or selector of the parent collection to check.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true if at least one element of the current collection is child of the parent collection
@return.description: Returns true if at least one element of the current collection is child of the parent collection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a set of elements containing all ancestors of each element in the collection. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Collection containing the ancestor elements
@return.description: Collection containing the ancestor elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a set of elements containing all ancestors of each element in the collection, up to (but not including) the element matched by the provided selector. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {String} Selector that indicates where to stop including
 ancestor elements
@param.description:
Selector that indicates where to stop including
 ancestor elements

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Collection containing the ancestor elements
@return.description: Collection containing the ancestor elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a set containing the closest matching ancestor for each item in the collection. If the item itself matches, it is added to the new set. Otherwise, the item's parent chain will be traversed until a match is found.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New collection containing the closest matching ancestors
@return.description: New collection containing the closest matching ancestors

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Searches the child elements of each item in the collection and returns a new collection containing the children that match the provided selector

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {String} Selector expression to match the child elements
 against
@param.description:
Selector expression to match the child elements
 against

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New collection containing the matching child elements
@return.description: New collection containing the matching child elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a new set of elements containing the child nodes of each item in the current set.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New collection containing the child nodes
@return.description: New collection containing the child nodes

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if at least one element in the collection passes the provided filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: selector {String|Function} Selector expression or filter function

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if at least one element matches
@return.description: true if at least one element matches

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reduce the set of matched elements to a single element.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Number} The position of the element in the collection
@param.description: The position of the element in the collection

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} A new collection containing one element
@return.description: A new collection containing one element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reduces the collection to the first element.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} A new collection containing one element
@return.description: A new collection containing one element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reduces the collection to the last element.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} A new collection containing one element
@return.description: A new collection containing one element

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing only the elements that have descendants matching the given selector

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} a new collection containing only elements with matching descendants
@return.description: a new collection containing only elements with matching descendants

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a new collection containing only those nodes that contain the given element. Also accepts a qxWeb collection or an Array of elements. In those cases, the first element in the list is used.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Collection with matching items
@return.description: Collection with matching items

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing the next sibling element of each item in the current set. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing next siblings
@return.description: New set containing next siblings

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing all following sibling elements of each item in the current set. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing following siblings
@return.description: New set containing following siblings

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing the following sibling elements of each item in the current set up to but not including any element that matches the given selector.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing following siblings
@return.description: New set containing following siblings

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing the previous sibling element of each item in the current set. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing previous siblings
@return.description: New set containing previous siblings

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing all preceding sibling elements of each item in the current set. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing preceding siblings
@return.description: New set containing preceding siblings

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing the preceding sibling elements of each item in the current set up to but not including any element that matches the given selector.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing preceding siblings
@return.description: New set containing preceding siblings

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a collection containing all sibling elements of the items in the current set. This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New set containing sibling elements
@return.description: New set containing sibling elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove elements from the collection that do not pass the given filter. This can be either a selector expression or a filter function

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} Reduced collection
@return.description: Reduced collection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets a new collection containing the offset parent of each item in the current set.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qxWeb} New collection containing offset parents
@return.description: New collection containing offset parents

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the first element in the collection is inserted into the document for which it was created.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true when the element is inserted into the document.
@return.description: true when the element is inserted into the document.
